fields.description:
*Step to reproduce:* 
 # Open the mobile application "Railway ticket
 # Turn or rotate screen to landscape mode

 * Expected result: The same information for the horizontal position 
 * Actual result: the screen brightness changes and an incorrect text message "You have no unused tickets..."
fields.summary: Usability bug: not enough information in the message when mobile device to the horizontal position

fields.description:
|*Step to reproduce:* # Open the mobile application "Railway ticket"
 # Turn or rotate screen to landscape mode|
| * Expected result: The same information for the horizontal position 
 * Actual result: the screen brightness changes and an incorrect text message "You have no unused tickets..."|
fields.summary: Usability bug: not enough information in the message when mobile device to the horizontal position

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce *

#1. Открыть в телефоне приложение "Железнодорожные билеты "Укрзалізниця"

#2. Кликнуть по полю "Звідки", набрать - Київ  (или выбрать с выпадающего меню)

#3. Кликнуть по полю "Куди", набрать - Львів  (или выбрать с выпадающего меню)

#4. Кликнуть по полю "Дата" -  выбрать с календаря любую дату с 10.05.2019 по 25.05.2019.  Нажать "ОК".

#5. Поле "час" - оставить по умолчанию.

#6. Внизу экрана нажать на "ПОШУК ПОЇЗДІВ"

#7. После 15 секундного перерыва появляется сообщение: "На жаль, на зазначену дату та напрямок поїздів або місць немає."

 

Expected result: В календаре доступны только те даты, на которые уже открыта предварительная продажа билетов.

Actual result: В календаре доступны даты, на которые еще не открыта предварительная продажа, с некорректным сообщением о том, что на эту дату мест нет.
fields.summary: В календаре открыты даты для предварительной продажи билетов за 60 дней, хотя реально продажа осуществляется за 45 суток.

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce *

#1. Открываем в телефоне приложение "Железнодорожные билеты "Укрзалізниця"

#2. Кликаем по полю "Звідки", набираем - Киев  (или выбираем с выпадающего меню)

#3. Кликаем по полю "Куди", набираем - Харьков  (или выбираем с выпадающего меню)

#4. Кликаем по полю "Дата" -  выбираем с календаря любую дату (например 30. 03.2019). Нажимаем "ОК".

#5. Поле "час" - оставляем по умолчанию.

#6. Нажимаем на "ПОШУК ПОЇЗДІВ"

#7. Выбираем любой поезд (например 016Л Рахів - Харків). Два раза кликаем по этому окошку.

#8. Выбираем место в вагоне, нажимаем на него. Внизу экрана высветилось сообщение "Вибрано місць: 1". Нажимаем на стрелочку.

#9. Появилось следующее сообщение "Вагон 4, місце 4, від 1359,31 грн.". Нажимаем "ОФОРМИТИ".

#10. В поле "Тип квитка" с выпадающего меню выбираем "дитячий".

#11. Справа появляется окошко "Дата народження". Вводим - 31.02.2007

#12. Вводим произвольные имя и фамилию.

#13. Внизу экрана нажимаем на кнопку "У КОШИК". Появляется сообщение "Квиток доданий до кошика". 

+Expected result:+ . 1. При вводе даты высвечивается сообщение: " Ввведіть дату у                                        форматі ДД ММ ГГГГ".

                            2. При вводе некоректной даты - сообщение об ошибке.

                            3. Отражение в билете той даты, которая введена.

+Actual result:+   1. При вводе даты нет сообщения о формате.

                        2. Нет сообщения об ошибке при вводе несуществующей даты.

                        3. В билете отразилась дата: " 2007-03-03"
fields.summary: При покупке детского билета и вводе даты рождения нет сообщения :"Введіть дату народження у форматі "ДД ММ ГГГГ". При вводе несуществующей даты, нет сообщения об ошибке.

fields.description:
Шаги воспроизведения:
 # Запустить приложение "УЗ"
 # Свернуть приложение "УЗ" в фоновый режим
 # Повернуть устройство( смартфон) в горизонтальное положение
 # Открыть фоновый режим приложений
 # Кликнуть на приложение "Уз"

Ожидаемый результат : приложение возобновило работу в горизонтальном положении

Фактический результат: приложение прервало работу и не запустилось
fields.summary: Приложение "Уз" , краш приложения , при автоповороте

fields.description:
Шаги воспроизведения:

1.Запустить приложение "УЗ"

2. Кликнуть на иконку выбора даты, выбрать дату (28.03.19) не нажимая "ок"

3. Осуществить поворот устройства(смартфон) в горизонтальное положение 

4. Осуществить поворот устройства (смартфон) в вертикальное положение

Ожидаемый результат :  дата осталась 28.03.19

Фактический результат: дата сбросилась на текущую сегодняшнего дня.
fields.summary: Приложение "Уз" , сброс даты , в поле календарь

fields.description:
*Preconditions:*

Download "Железнодорожные билеты" app from Play Market and installation it.

*Steps to reproduce:*

1. Open "Железнодорожные билеты" app

2. Select "Украинский" in "Выбор языка" menu

3. Pay attention for language in main menu

3. Relaunch the app

4. Pay attention for language in main menu

 

Expected result : language in the main menu change after first changing.

Actual result: language in the main menu change after relaunch app only.
fields.summary: Language are not changed, when switching to different language at the first time

Download "Железнодорожные билеты" app from Play Market and installation it.

Expected result : language in the main menu change after first changing.

Actual result: language in the main menu change after relaunch app only.

fields.description:
1.Открыть приложение  УкрЗалізниця 
2.Выбрать направление :"Откуда" и "Куда"
3. Нажать на "Оформить заказ"
4.Воспроизвести покупку билетов

UZ Android RailwayTickets

fields.description:
# Clone a new repo
 # Use gitflow button in toolbar to init the repo.
 # Use gitflow button again to attempt to start working on a feature

App thinks that both dev and master are feature branches, and present the "finish feature branch" dialog.

If you use other options button to start work on new feature, the branch is not in "features/xxx" branch naming scheme.

Workaround is to revert to prior release of git, then app behaves as normal.

I marked this highest priority because it blocks ability to branch and work for users using gitflow.
fields.summary: Gitflow Not compatible with git 2.21.0

fields.description:
Here's how it can be reproduced, all the time:
 # Make sure you have two users on a Windows machine
 # Sign in with one of them and open sourcetree, while having a couple of repositories open in Sourcetree
 # Lock that user (don't sign out) and sign in using the other user
 # After a minute, lock the second user and sign in using the initial user
 # You'll be faced with the crash report dialog for sourcetree
fields.summary: Sourcetree Crashes Every time I switch users on Windows

fields.description:
When viewing the list of file changes for a commit, if a minified file is included in the list and selected, the file preview to the right of the change list causes SourceTree to hang.

 

Steps to reproduce the problem:
 # Add a new minified file to current branch/Edit a minified file for a branch
 # Commit the changes/Try to stage the changes to the file
 # View the file preview for the file
fields.summary: SourceTree Hangs when viewing minified file preview

fields.description: SourceTree can view bookmarks in Mercurial repos, but can't make changes to them (as far as I can tell). Using bookmarks instead of branches is a popular Mercurial workflow (and is [recommended by Atlassian's tutorial|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/use-a-mercurial-bookmark-to-update-a-file-734071280.html]), so being able to create, move, delete, and sync bookmarks would make SourceTree much more useful to Mercurial users.
fields.summary: Full support for Mercurial bookmarks
1Z0-348 Dumps

fields.description:
when sourcetree start up i click on tools -> Options -> Git -> Enable git support.
than sourcetree stuck.

when you enter Windows Task Manger(ctrl+alt+del) you can see that the number of processes is growing fast to thousands.

it looks like memory leaking.
fields.summary: Sourcetree stuck on startup and create thousands of windows processes

fields.description: Is there any wiki or place to know the detailed explanation about all the parameters of user.config in the sourcetree? I'm not able to find it anywhere.
fields.summary: Need to know all the parameter's and it explanations in sourcetree user.config

fields.description: When I connect to my Windows desktop over Microsoft Remote Desktop with Sourcetree running on the remote machine it crashes every time as soon as the connection has been established.
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes when using over Remote Desktop

fields.description:
ERROR [2019-03-25 02:45:37,618] [1] [SourceTree.UI.OnboardingManager] [Log] - Unable to submit Finished Registration Analytics
System.AggregateException: One or more errors occurred. ---> System.Net.Http.HttpRequestException: An error occurred while sending the request. ---> System.Net.WebException: The underlying connection was closed: An unexpected error occurred on a send. ---> System.IO.IOException: Unable to read data from the transport connection: An existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host.
fields.summary: Sourcetree installation is stuck in registration page

fields.description:
Even with "Perform submodule actions recursively" turned off, performing a Discard/Reset on a submodule edit in the main project performs a recursive call. If you have nestled dependencies, this will become a much larger operation than desired, and forces you to use the terminal or accept a "christmas tree" filestructure where several submodules are stored multiple times, which makes the repo far larger than it needs to be. In our case we have 6 submodules with interdependencies, which leads to 47 submodules when fully "expanded".

The fix should be as simple as removing the --recursive flag if it's off in options. There might be other places where this flag is ignored, so might be worth checking all usages of --recursive in your code.

I'm demonstrating the bug in the two attached screenshots.
fields.summary: Sourcetree does a recursive call when reverting submodule edits even when recursive is turned off

fields.description: The "Jump To Commit" functionality in SourceTree would be more user friendly if the text input field had focus by default when it is triggered (Jump To -> Commit...) as the user most likely want to input some text. Not having focus means that an extra mouse click is needed before it is possible to input anything.
fields.summary: Set default focus to text input for Jump To Commit

fields.description: The diff window never loads the selected file ! :(
fields.summary: Cannot preview files

fields.description: When working with many submodules (our case is +200 in some projects), it is very time-consuming scrolling up to a submodule. Some kind of keyboard navigation would definitively help a lot: may be start typing and go to the submodule that match the keystrokes, as with in Windows Explorer, or a submodules filter that allows more powerful search (partial matches not only at the beginning of the string...)
fields.summary: Fast keyboard navigation in submodules tree

fields.description: When closes the Options dialog (Escape, close button, Cancel, OK, with or without making changes to options), the application crashes completely.
fields.summary: ST crashes when closing the options dialog

fields.description: Please allow encoding selection in internal diff view. One project may have more than one file encoding. Now text will be garbled if it's encoding is different from the default encoding set in Options.
fields.summary: encoding selection in internal diff view

fields.description: After installation the registration wizard shows up. There I am asked to logon either with a Bitbucket Server or a Bitbucket account. When I choose "Bitbucket" the Atlassian login screen opens in my browser. When I log in and grant access a new screen "Authentication Successful" with a localhost address shows up I cannot continue in the welcome wizard. This means I cannot use the program.
fields.summary: Registration with BitBucket account fails

fields.description: When I stash my updates and check the "Keep stashed changes" option, the stash gets created but my updates are still removed from the code base.
fields.summary: Stashing using "keep changes" does not work on v3.1.2

fields.description:
If you take a look at the UI and have a lot of branches there is no chance to see the actual Branch without scrolling. It should be there and on the UI there are a lot of free spaces to put a label somewhere.

Here is an example from a daily scenario: if you want to merge a branch into the current branch the application ask you the question: 'Are you sure to want to branch XYZ into your current branch?'. And at this point I always want to double check, that I'm merging to the proper place, but can't see the actual branch. It would also great to just simply assign the name of the actual branch to the question, like: 'Are you sure to want to branch XYZ into your current branch (ABC)?'
fields.summary: Show actual Branch on UI
Adding local project by dropping folder on App window

fields.description:
I added a custom dictionary in MS Office, but I don't understand what the hell it has to do with SourceTree ???
 !image-2019-03-21-10-33-56-732.png|thumbnail! 

Sourcetree detected the invalid Dictionary file references. 

{code:java}
C:\Users\xxx\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Office\16.0\5eb1c305\Proofing\RoamingCustom.dic
{code}

And if I don't want my dictionary be deleted, the frikin Sourcetree shuts down and does not start... What the hell is that?
fields.summary: Can't start SourceTree (custom dictionaries)

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce
 # "Tools" > "Options"
 # Confirm the Option dialog appears
 # (For example) Click the "Full Name:" input field and rename
 # Press the Enter key

h4. Expected Behavior
 * It's closed and new options are applied to Sourcetree just like clicking the "OK" button

h4. Actual Behavior
 * Noop

h4. Notes

On the other hand, the Esc key can close and cancel it just like clicking the "Cancel" button.
fields.summary: Options should be okayed by the Enter key

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce
 # "Repository" > "Interactive Rebase..."
 # Wait until "Rebasing interactively..." ends
 # Confirm the "Interactive rebase from <hash>" screen appears
 # Press the Esc key

h4. Expected Behavior
 * It's closed and the interactive rebase is canceled just like clicking the "Cancel" button

h4. Actual Behavior
 * Noop
fields.summary: Interactive Rebase should be canceled by the Escape key

fields.description: There should be an option to close Pageant when SourceTree closes.  This minimizes attack surface area.
fields.summary: Option to close Pageant when SourceTree closes

fields.description:
It's not possible to move a repository to a local Folder in the new treeview.

Steps to reproduce:
 * Create a local Folder in Sourcetree
 * Add a new repository to sourcetree
 * Try to move it into the Folder. It's not possible

In addition, repositories which already are in folders, are thrown out of it if it is accidentaly moved for a Pixel.
fields.summary: Move a repository to a local folder not working

fields.description:
to reproduce:
 # right click on local branch
 # select "Create pull request..."
 # browser opens url which is incorrect:
 ## [https://bitbucket.org*//*]myRepo/blablabla   <- there's double slash after bitbucket.org so I get 404 in the browser
fields.summary: Branch -> right click -> create pull request ... opens browser with invalid url

fields.description:
Just updated to the new 3.1.2 release (as prompted by SourceTree) and it now constantly freezes in the History View. The diff view seems to be the problem, at least the only times when the History View works is when there is no diff to show. As soon as I click on a history entry it freezes again.

Complete showstopper, app unusable in this state.
fields.summary: SourceTree freezes

fields.description:
If an update for Sourcetree is available the notification on top right includes a link to the changelog. This link does not link to the changelog it links tou the sourcetreeapp homepage.

If you call the change log from the help menu, the link works correctly.

 

Btw,: It would be nice if one can find the changelog on the website manually.
fields.summary: Same links at two places link to different websites

fields.description:
# Start the App
 # Start clicking on commits.
 # App is frozen (no response, CPU seems to 100%)
Sometimes it happens after clicking on 1-2 commits, sometimes after 5.
Maybe it depends on the frequency of clicking, hard to say - however I was always able to reproduce the bug.
fields.summary: 3.1.2 - ST is frozen after 3 seconds of clicking

fields.description:
When using New Tab :
- drag 'n drop with folders and repositories is really hard :
folders seem to be alphabetically sorted so no way to organize further.
- when doing a drag'n drop operation with a repository and dropping it in a folder, very often it is moved elsewhere, or a another folder is moved inside another third one.
That's very confusing, i have to restart SourceTree.
- when doing a drag'n drop operation with a repository and moving the mouse without dropping it, no way to make the vertical scrollbar scroll up or down, even with up or down arrows or pageup pagedown.
really not practical.
fields.summary: New Tab folders and repos drag 'n drop problems
Terminal doesn't open

fields.description:
SourceTree regularly checks for changes every 10 minutes in background, but all of these background requests are sent without any credentials. So this requests end up with unauthorized status code.

When I perform clone/pull/fetch manually then credentials are properly sent to the server and request is successful.

We use GitLab server in our company and if SourceTree sends too many requests without authentication then GitLab thinks it's an attack and block IP address for one hour.

Is it a correct behavior to send background requests without credentials the first and then try it again with credentials. I also checked Windows Credential Manager for old records, but there is only one record with current credentials.
fields.summary: No credentials are sent while checking for remote changes in background
Clone from source Tree require login then it fails

fields.description:
I have new PC in the company and I have problem with cloning of the repository in sourcetree.

In my previous PC it was working.
I can login into stash repository on the web but I can't clone the repository in the source tree
Problem is with authorization - see attachments
fields.summary: Could not create SSL/TSL secure channel

fields.description:
The installation screen requires login authentication to a Bitbucket Server.

Perhaps, it will be a better user experience to provide an option to register via email address.

 

Found a similar discussion at 

https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Latest-SourceTree-on-Mac-can-t-get-past-Account-window/qaq-p/130890
fields.summary: Installation requires authentication to Bitbucket Server

fields.description: Sourcetree crashes/showing blank plage when maximizing the active window. Should I just downgrade it?
fields.summary: App crashes frequently since updating to 3.0.17

fields.description:
I have version 3.0.8 installed and it prompted me that an update was available. I decided i wanted to check if there was a beta of SourceTree and went and got it. Installed it and while it did install alongside the other SourceTree which is nice it did not pull any of the settings or configuration files from that SourceTree install. So this new beta that i installed has none of my accounts setup and is a fresh clean install which isn't what i was wanting. Having to resetup SourceTree isn't something i wanted to spend my day doing. Can you please implement a way for us to bring in the config from another install to speed up the out of the box setup

 

On a side note i am sorry if i did not create this issue correctly, just wanted to share some feedback.
fields.summary: SourceTree Beta doesn't acknowledge other installs

fields.description:
Sourcetree's integrated diff tool no longer highlights a removed line in red if the first two characters of that line were hyphen characters "--". 

This seems like a bug to me because I can't find any settings that would trigger this behavior.  Turning off language-specific syntax highlighting has no effect.  Am I missing something?

I first noticed this happening summer of 2018.
fields.summary: Diff panel no longer indicates the removal of lines that began with "--"

fields.description: Just updated to v3.1.1. The app is unusable due to continual lock ups.
fields.summary: Version 3.1.1 continually locks up with "Not Responding" in the title bar
UI became uglier

fields.description:
When adding a new repository tab (New tab > Add), I am prompted to set a custom name for easy reference, which will become the tab's name.

Upon exiting and re-entering Sourcetree the tab names are lost and reverted to the root folder's name. This is a bit of a nuissance since in my case all my projects' root folders are called 'htdocs', causing confusion on which tab is which project, with the risk of operating on the wrong project or forcing me to close all tab add the one I need back.
fields.summary: Repository tab name not retained after closing

fields.description: On the diff panel, the horizontal scroll bar is hidden until I scroll down to the end of the file
fields.summary: Horizontal scrollbar not showing on diff panel

fields.description: The embedded 7zip version is vulnerable. Please update
fields.summary: Embedded 7z vulnerable with a cvs score of 10

fields.description:
After you stage a new file, if you make changes to that file, it is _*not*_ listed in the _Unstaged files_ area. You can see the behavior in the screen capture below. 

!st-add-stage-no-changes.gif!

Refreshing and restarting Sourcetree *does not fix it*. The output of {{git status}} is:
{code:java}
$ git status
On branch master

No commits yet

Changes to be committed:
  (use "git rm --cached <file>..." to unstage)

        new file:   foo.txt

Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add <file>..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git checkout -- <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)

        modified:   foo.txt
{code}
fields.summary: Sourcetree does not list changes to added file

fields.description:
Hi Team,

We have Packaged the Sourcetree Application and we are trying to use the Application as a remote application via Citrix. Using this Sourcetree We are able to connect to our Bitbucket server hosted in one of server and we are able to clone the projects to our local laptops.But we are facing the below issues while doing so. Can you pleas help us.

* Once the cloning is done and if we disconnect the session and while Reconnecting to sourcetree its asking for again Registration process where we need to enter our bitbucket username and credentials.Is it possible without going for Registration process again and again when we open source tree?

* Also once we done with cloning our repository we are able to see the changes like commit,tags,File status etc in the source tree viewing Dashboard.But once we closed the session and opening the source tree again we are unable to view our cloned projects in the Dashboard even though the repositories are still available in Disk.Can you please let us know how to view our cloned repository in the Sourcetree Dashboard
fields.summary: Unable to view the cloned projects in source tree console

fields.description:
Hi, 

We are using the SourceTree to connect to GitLab, however after downloading and installing it redirects to localhost and is failing couple of times before being successful. We have to refresh or close the session and select Bitbucket login several times before we could get a message that says Confirm access to your account. We are using the IE browser. 

 

Please let us know if this could be resolved, it is weirdly functioning. 

 

Thank you,

Rashmi
fields.summary: Installation of sourcetree is failing couple of times before authenticating successfully

fields.description:
In prior versions, the Diff Merge Tool selection was being forgotten every time the app was opened. In the current version, the selection remains, but the subsequent behavior is the same. That is, when you select to Launch External Merge Tool it appears to be doing something (the dialog opens) but the merge tool is never launched. Sometimes you can see the Unstaged files refresh in the background and show the 4 temp merge files created.

The solution is to open the options, select another merge tool, and then switch back to our selected option (P4Merge in this case). After that, the merge functionality works as expected. This has to be repeated every time the app is opened fresh.
fields.summary: Merge Tool Selection Not Persisting

fields.description: When applying a stash onto a branch which results in merge conflicts, the UI does not indicate anything. It appears as though the stash has not been applied (nothing to commit, no pending changes, nothing). If you switch to another repo tab and back, then the status is correctly shown in the UI. This was extremely confusing the first time until I figured out what was going on.
fields.summary: Apply Stash with Conflict No Indication

fields.description: I'm running along with several GIT repo's cloned locally and opened in tabs in SourceTree. At various times, a subset of the tabs will just disappear. I can click the + icon and select the repo from the list of local folders and it shows back up fine. I have never found a connection between when it happens and what actions I'm doing. It is particularly odd as it will take out tabs I am not currently, and haven't in a long while, interacted with in the app!
fields.summary: Repo Tabs Disappear

fields.description: Loading the changelog for older commits (file changes and diffs) has deteriorated significantly after 2.3.5 - switching revisions lists the individual files and diffs quite fast for ~10 minutes of uptime, after that diffs stop loading until application restart. Diffs for local uncommited changes are normally working OK, remote diffs are not loading.
fields.summary: Diff view stops loading differences after a pull

fields.description:
When resolving an edit/delete conflict while merging, when attempting to resolve the conflict by accepting the 'deleted' side, SourceTree throws the error "Could not update one or more files, please check that no other application is locking your files".

The problem is not that the file is in use, but that it does not exist - SourceTree should just mark the issue as resolved in the staging area and leave the file deleted.

Here is a detailed reproduction scenario on SourceTree 3.0.17 for Windows, completely from scratch:
 # Create a (local) repository
 # Commit a file 'test.txt' (empty) into the master branch
 # Create branches 'a' and 'b' from master
 # In branch 'b', edit test.txt by entering some text in it, then commit. Make sure to close the text editor.
 # In branch 'a', delete test.txt and commit
 # Merge branch 'b' into 'a'. This reports a conflict on test.txt (edit/delete conflict)
 # Attempt to resolve the conflict by on the "File status" tab, right click the conflicting file, resolve conflicts, resolve using 'mine' (i.e. the 'delete' should win).
 # Click OK to the prompt on resolving to the state as of the mentioned commit
 # Observe the error prompt "Could not update one or more files, please check that no other application is locking your files".

This issue was previously reported 5 years ago on version 1.6.5 in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-2366 and is as valid today as it was 5 years ago. I'm opening the issue as new as advised by Michael Minns in that thread.

Marked "High" because this blocks normal workflow and another Git client has to be used to get out of the situation.
fields.summary: Can't Resolve Using Mine on delete/edit conflict

fields.description:
Win 7 Pro 64 Bit

JRE: 1.8

Sourcetree: 3.0.17.2659
fields.summary: Wrong branch marking

fields.description: When I try to use the function "Jump to commit" from the "Log / History"-tab in any repository and the dialog box to enter SHA appears I expect the only input in the dialog to be selected by default so I can paste in my SHA from the clipboard without clicking in the input text field. See attached video of issue.
fields.summary: "Jump to commit" should be selected after dialog open

fields.description: Upon starting SourceTree looses tabs from time to time. It writes in New Tab that it can't find folders of repos. Can you please check it. Probably it does some other calls on startup and others may prevent tab from appearing
fields.summary: Upon opening SourceTree it closes tabs because it thinks folders are missing

fields.description:
I often encounter this issue:

 

*Background:*

Sometimes I want to see what changes were in my last commit.  To do this I select the currently-checked-out branch in the left side-bar so that the main view will show the list of commits across all the different branches.

 

*Problem:*

When I click a branch in the left side-bar and the main view switches to show all the different commits, it often has an old commit (from several months ago) selected, so that if I click on the most-recent commit, it shows a diff between the two commits rather than just showing the changes in the most recent commit.

To fix this I need to scroll down to the old commit, click on it to deselect it, and then scroll back up to select the most recent commit.

It isn't a major issue, but it has been happening for a long time (many months, if not more than a year), and has gotten annoying enough to be worth filing a bug about.
fields.summary: Branch view often automatically selects an old commit

fields.description:
I have always been anoyed that I could not easily use the terminal in sourcetree to do some GIT operations as it turns out the keys listed in Pageant to operate Sourcetree on Windows normally are not accessible.

Today I found a solution but it is hard to implement this consistently on my own since it depends on setting the GIT_SSH to point to plink.

Since you provide plink in the application folder I need to set this again on every update as the application folder SourceTree is installed in contains the version number :(.

I think this might be easily solved by your team by setting the proper value of to the GIT_SSH environment variable on invocation of the terminal from your side as you would now the exact version and path when starting the terminal from SourceTree.
fields.summary: Set GIT_SSH environment variable for Plink on Windows so Pageant keys are also accessible in terminal

fields.description:
You can view a diff on a single file over multiple commits in the Log/History tab of source tree.  

However I am not able to do this in the Search tab.  This functionality really needs to be extended to the Search tab, as we put the ticket number in our commit message and when looking up code from an old ticket you want to search for all commits with the ticket number in the message.  You can do this on the search tab, but not get the consolidated diff that you can on the Log/History tab.

Another thing is that the consolidated diff that you can get through the Log/History tab is only from one commit to another.  Eg; it includes all the commits in between.  You can't just say show me this one and that one together.

All these things are an essential part of our workflow and could be done in SVN.  Now we have moved to git/SourceTree, how do we do these things?

 

Can the above functionality please be implemented in SourceTree, I think it would really add value to the product.
fields.summary: Diff on file over multiple commits
Unable to check out a specific branch using the tree view

fields.description:
Please add options for displaying history graph by categories.

I.e. I would like to specify at the Tools->Options some branch categories (i.e. feature branches, develop branch, release candidate branches, release and hotfixes branches) and the naming rules for these categories (i.e. feature branches are started with 'FTR*', release candidates are started with 'RC*' and so on) and the I want the history graph to be displayed as:

 - commits at 'feature branches' at the very left

 - commits at 'developer branch' next after 'feature branches'

 - commits at 'rc branches' next after 'developer branch'

 - and so on...

 

So all time the graph will be shown similar as on [https://i.stack.imgur.com/vPiEW.png.] This will make commits reading much more clear and easy.
fields.summary: Splitting history graph to categories

fields.description:
Please add an new tab for executed  git commands, So that people can be more familiar with git commands by using this wonderful tool.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Please add a new tab for executed git commands

fields.description:
At our company we use pull *--rebase* as default to avoid local merges when updating our dev branches. This usually works well.

But if while rebasing the local commits a conflict happens, this leads to an visually unclear state. We can solve the conflict, but then it's not evident that a  git *rebase --continue* is needed to properly complete the pull!

People sometimes continue on working on their code, not realising that they are still in the middle of the pull, and mess up their working copy.

It would help a lot if the Pull button would indicate that the pull/rebase is not completed yet. Maybe it could change the text into "Continue Rebase"... Or display a warning / hint when conflicts are solved during a rebase.

 

Thank you.
fields.summary: Show that a rebase is still going, after a pull --rebase that caused conflicts

fields.description:
External merge or diff tools are not started anymore. This affects my workflow when I e.g. have to resolve conflicts or just view the diffs (Ctrl + D).

To make it work again I first have to go into _Tools -> Options -> Diff_ and just confirm the dialog with _OK_. (As if the external tool settings get lost when SourceTree starts up, and need to be confirmed again.)

I currently use P4Merge as tool, but the bug happens no matter what tool is set.
fields.summary: External Diff / Merge tools not starting

 * press enter to activate (does nothing)

fields.description:
*[nbdime|https://github.com/jupyter/nbdime]* tool provides a much cleaner diff view for jupyter notebooks, and it can be configured as a default diff tool for all _.ipynb_ files.

Unfortunately, its output is not recognized by the SourceTree viewer, even though there are not so many differences.

This is to request nbdime output support in the diff part of the main window of SourceTree, so that changes in jupyter notebooks can be manipulated more conveniently.
fields.summary: support jupyter notebook diff view provided by nbdime tool

fields.description:
SourceTree fails to clone giving this error:

Command: git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks ls-remote https://myuser@bitbucket.server_url/scm/pa/test_repo.git Output: Error: fatal: unable to access 'https://myuser@bitbucket.server_url/scm/pa/test_repo.git/': schannel: next InitializeSecurityContext failed: Unknown error (0x80092013) - The revocation function was unable to check revocation because the revocation server was offline.

Appears to be related to the update to Git for Windows to use Windows Secure Channel instead of OpenSSL:

[https://github.com/git-for-windows/git/releases/tag/v2.14.0.windows.1]

Similar bugs reported for GitHub:

[https://github.com/desktop/desktop/issues/3260]

[https://github.com/desktop/desktop/issues/2187]

[https://github.com/desktop/desktop/issues/2414]

Same work around applies, disable revocation checks via this command:

git config --global http.schannel.checkRevoke false
fields.summary: Clone using HTTPS fails due to revocation check with git version 2.20.1.windows.1

fields.description: Would you please add a theme with dark colors? Working with the text based interface with a white background is not easy. A theme with dark colors, would make the interface much easier on the eyes.
fields.summary: Dark colored theme

fields.description:
I use dark Gmail, dark IntelliJ IDEA, dark browser, everything is dark except SourceTree.

The white user interface kills my eyes. Can we have an option for a dark theme?
fields.summary: Implement a dark theme/skin

fields.description:
I'm just starting to use SourceTree 3.0.17, and cannot figure out how to change the default working copy (local repo) location during cloning from BitBucket.  The earlier SourceTree version can follow Tools > Options > General > Misc ([https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Questions/Change-default-repo-location/qaq-p/174857]), or similar to specify a custom path where all the cloned repos will be located.  But the latest version does not seem to have this option anymore.

We are using Eclipse for most of the development work, so it's preferable to have SourceTree clone to Eclipse workspace by default.  Otherwise, we have to manually change the path for each clone.

Thanks in advance.
h3. Andy
h3. 


h3. *{color:#172b4d}h3. Workaround{color}*
Currently you must set the full path for each clone
fields.summary: Change default working copy location when cloning from BitBucket

fields.description: Source Tree does have many hotkeys, but it would be very nice if I could open folder with selected file via hitting hotkey. See screenshot. Suggested hotkey is Shift+Ctrl+E.
fields.summary: Add hotkey 'Show in Explorer'

fields.description:
When I did the following steps , after that, sourcetree became never able to read a specific repository even though I did following.

 

I did below:

1) opened sourcetree and added repository "A".

2) repo "A" was read correctly and I was able to operate at that time

3) I created a brunch

4) I noticed there were 2 pulls in the trunk

5) I selected "pull" button on the UI screen

6) for a while I was able to use source tree but it frozen suddenly

7) then it displayed "no response" then I was forced to close sourcetree.

 

after that, I opened sourcetree again and added same repo "A".

but sourcetree froze and gone to "no response" status.

After that whenever I tried to add repo "A" , it gone to the freeze and no responce.  

(but when I added another repo "B", sourcetree didn't freeze and I can use smoothly. it always happens on repo "A".)

 

To solve this issue, I tried below but it doesn't help me.

・uninstall sourcetree and re-install

・reinstall the repo"A"

 

Do you have another solution?
fields.summary: SourceTree froze and crashed when pull the update from "pull" button on UI screen to brunch

fields.description:
Cloning an svn repo fails with the latest version (3.0.17) of SourceTree for Windows. 

 

For comparison, I can successfully run `git svn clone svnRepo -s`, where "svnRepo" is the same URL that I gave SourceTree.  

 

The error SourceTree gives me is:

 
{code:java}
Command: perl.exe C:\Users\myUser\AppData\Local\SourceTree\app-3.0.17\tools\svn.pl info https://mySvnRepo/svn
Output: 
Error: System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception: The system cannot find the file specified
Command: git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks ls-remote https://mySvnRepo/svn
Output: 
Error: fatal: unable to access 'https://mySvnRepo/svn': schannel: next InitializeSecurityContext failed: Unknown error (0x80092012) - The revocation function was unable to check revocation for the certificate.
{code}
 

Interestingly, I decided to try running `perl.exe C:\Users\myUser\AppData\Local\SourceTree\app-3.0.17\tools\svn.pl` manually, and I got the following error:
{code:java}
perl.exe C:\Users\myUser\AppData\Local\SourceTree\app-3.0.17\tools\svn.pl
Can't locate Git/SVN/Utils.pm in @INC (you may need to install the Git::SVN::Utils module) (@INC contains: /usr/lib/perl5/site_perl /usr/share/perl5/site_perl /usr/lib/perl5/vendor_perl /usr/share/perl5/vendor_perl /usr/lib/perl5/core_perl /usr/share/perl5/core_perl) at C:\Users\myUser\AppData\Local\SourceTree\app-3.0.17\tools\svn.pl line 3.
BEGIN failed--compilation aborted at C:\Users\myUser\AppData\Local\SourceTree\app-3.0.17\tools\svn.pl line 3.{code}
Please fix this bug.
fields.summary: Clone of svn repo fails
Gitconfig file gets overwritten everytime sourcetree gets started, forgetting my diff path.

fields.description:
By default when setting Beyond Compare as the merge tool BCompare.exe is executed.  BComp.exe is the proper exe to use on windows for merging.  BCompare doesn't work for merging if a beyond compare window is already open since it will use that window and then exit immediately.

See: [https://www.scootersoftware.com/v4help/index.html?command_line_reference.html]

"BCompare.exe - This is the main application. Only one copy will run at a time, regardless of how many windows you have open. If you launch a second copy it will tell the existing copy to start a comparison and exit immediately.

BComp.exe - This is a Win32 GUI program. If launched from a version control system, it should work just fine. If launched from a console window, the console (or batch file) will not wait for it."
fields.summary: For Beyond Compare use BComp.exe

fields.description: Suggestion:  Add ability to minimize to System Tray (with minimize to task bar or none) and create a notification badge if there is any new git push/fetch incoming/needing to download
fields.summary: System Tray

fields.summary: Opening repo crashes app

fields.description:
It would be nice if version 3.x.x doesn't always stores the account passwords.

If password storage could be disabled or at least only stored until end of application, it would be much more secure.

However since windows password dialg won't have the don't store password check, this isn't possible right now with the windows credential store in background.

 

Only rather time consuming workaround. Delete all credentials at end of sourcetree usage.
fields.summary: Option for store Password until end of session

fields.description:
If user enters invalid password it is stored in passwd file:

%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\passwd

 

It is never corrected if the user later enters the correct password.

Suggest purging the hash stored if login fails.

 

Note: I tried to put this as a bug but the fields don't show up when I select Issue Type bug.
fields.summary: Credential Store
